---
title: "Crops"
---



This section contains the documentation for `Crops` models in APSIM Next Generation. The `Crops` models are released as part of the APSIM Next Generation. The model is defined under [Resources](https://github.com/APSIMInitiative/ApsimX/tree/master/Models/Resources) folder in the APSIM Next Generation repository. 

For each crop, the documentation is organised as the original model structure defined in the `JSON` file.

```{r list-crops, echo=FALSE, results='asis'}
# List subdirectories under Crops/
crop_dirs <- list.dirs(path = here::here("docs/Crops"), full.names = FALSE, recursive = FALSE)
crop_dirs <- crop_dirs[grepl("^[A-Z]", crop_dirs)]

get_progress <- function(crop) {
    # Default progress to 0
    progress <- 0
    crop_path <- here::here("docs/Crops", crop, "index.qmd")
    # Attempt to read YAML-style header from HTML
    if (!file.exists(crop_path)) {
        return(progress)
    }
    html_lines <- readLines(crop_path, warn = FALSE)
    if (length(html_lines) > 0 && grepl("^---", html_lines[1])) {
        # Extract YAML block
        yaml_block <- html_lines[2:which(html_lines == "---")[2] - 1]
        yaml_list <- tryCatch(yaml::yaml.load(paste(yaml_block, collapse = "\n")), error = function(e) NULL)
        if (!is.null(yaml_list$doc_progress)) {
            progress <- as.numeric(yaml_list$doc_progress)
        }
    }
    return(progress)
} 
# Create HTML interface
cat("::: {.grid}\n\n")
for (crop in crop_dirs) {
    progress <- get_progress(crop)
    cat(glue::glue(
        '
:::{{.g-col-4 .p-3 .border .rounded}}

<a href="{crop}">
<img src="/images/{tolower(crop)}.png" alt="{crop} icon" width="100%" height="100%" style="margin-bottom: 0.5rem;" />
</a>

[Explore {crop} â†’]({crop})

<div style="margin-top: 0.5rem;">
<div style="background-color: #e0e0e0; border-radius: 5px; overflow: hidden; height: 1rem;">
<div style="width: {progress}%; background-color: #4caf50; height: 100%;"></div>
</div>
<small>{progress}% complete</small>
</div>



:::\n\n

'
    ))
}

cat(":::\n")
```
